etymologies: late Middle English: from earlier ebon (via Old French and Latin from Greek ebenos ‘ebony tree’), perhaps on the pattern of ivory

definitions: heavy blackish or very dark brown timber from a mainly tropical tree.
shortDefinitions: heavy blackish or very dark brown timber from tropical tree

definitions: a very dark brown or black color

examples.text: his smile flashed against the ebony of his skin

shortDefinitions: very dark brown or black colour

definitions: a tree of tropical and warm-temperate regions which produces ebony.

notes.text: Genera Diospyros and Euclea, family Ebenaceae: numerous species, in particular D. ebenum

shortDefinitions: tree of tropical and warm-temperate regions

definitions: used in names of trees that produce timber similar to ebony, e.g. Jamaican ebony or American ebony.
shortDefinitions: used in names of trees that produce timber similar to ebony
